nodes.text: Reegas Vance was a male Human gambler who lived around the time of the Second Galactic Civil War. In 41.5 ABY, at the Black Hole cantina in Farpoint, on the planet Fhost, Vance played a game of sabacc against Earsh, Khedryn Faal, and Flaygin, using Corellian Gambit rules. In the final round, he lost to Faal, although the result was due—unbeknownst to both Faal and Vance—to the manipulation of nearby Jedi Knight Jaden Korr with the Force. A deadly brawl then broke out in the cantina over the coordinates to a site located by Faal. In the aftermath of the brawl Vance was killed by Kell Douro just as he found the storage crystal with the coordinates.
Reegas Vance appeared in Paul S. Kemp's first Star Wars novel, Crosscurrent, which was published on January 26, 2010.
